TopicTitle: Space Shuttle Pack for ksp 1.0.4 dev thread

Articles.Content:
Any requests for any of these vehicles wanted in KSP:

[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:NASA_vehicles](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:NASA_vehicles)

Worth a look anyway. Quite interesting

- - - Updated - - -

Also will have a go at adding some textures and adding some front wing extenders for the 747. And correct the tail and the front wheel
[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronaut_transfer_van](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronaut_transfer_van)

![1280px-Astrovan_at_KSC_LC-39A.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/28/Astrovan_at_KSC_LC-39A.jpg/1280px-Astrovan_at_KSC_LC-39A.jpg)

Looks fun.

Will have to add built in kerbal seats so you can see them in the bus.
it will be good for cinematics
Love how its the same colour sceme as the early nasa 747
yea me 2

> 
> [https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/28/Astrovan_at_KSC_LC-39A.jpg/1280px-Astrovan_at_KSC_LC-39A.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/28/Astrovan_at_KSC_LC-39A.jpg/1280px-Astrovan_at_KSC_LC-39A.jpg)

> 
> Will have to add built in kerbal seats so you can see them in the bus.

The video-trailer v1.0 bring one "kerbalized"

> 
> Yes you can attach screen shot. How are you attaching it to the shuttle?

I actually figured it out. It was because I was attaching it to the FSS base to have it rotate up. Now, having it attached to the CSS Crew Compartment, it works without clipping. I only wish the Canadarm actually worked right so I could maneuver the module out of the cargo bay without RCS.

> 
> Any requests for any of these vehicles wanted in KSP:
> [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:NASA_vehicles](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:NASA_vehicles)
> 
> Worth a look anyway. Quite interesting

They weren't exactly on that list, but a CST-100 and/or an X-37C would be awesome to have on KSP.
I know there is a SpaceX Mod put out by LazTech but he's fallen off the radar and it doesn't work in 1.0 + because of the new aerodynamics model. If that could be tackled, I'd lose my mind over it.

> 
> I know there is a SpaceX Mod put out by LazTech but he's fallen off the radar and it doesn't work in 1.0 + because of the new aerodynamics model. If that could be tackled, I'd lose my mind over it.

Wonder if Felbourn would tackle that. The problems appear to be cfg related...

What about the modified jet (the one the astronauts used to,get a feel for the shuttle before its,first flight. Also, what about the astronaut transfer jets (forgot their,name) that was used to,transport astronauts from houston to the cape?
Astrovan!...astrovan!...astrovan!!

> What about the modified jet (the one the astronauts used to,get a feel for the shuttle before its,first flight. Also, what about the astronaut transfer jets (forgot their,name) that was used to,transport astronauts from houston to the cape?

Those are the T-38s. Originally they were trainer jets. Now, they are still used and NASA uses them to fairy astronauts to and from Cape Canaveral (Well, used to when we still flew from Cape with people and hopefully will again with the Commercial Crew Service). In response to Felbourn tackling that problem, that'd be awesome. It is a cfg issue, not a model issue. The models look great and work great, used to at least. It is just with the new aerodynamics model.

> 
> Wonder if Felbourn would tackle that. The problems appear to be cfg related...

Fixing the SpaceX mod is easy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I'm currently using it in my RSSRO install. There were not alot of fixing to do to be honest. If anyone could get in contact with LazarusLuan and get the rights to open a unofficial thread, I could give you guys the version that works in 1.0.4.
